newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha firms, with U.S interest, LPG strength.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha firms, with U.S interest, LPG strength.

text.p: NWE naphtha was shunted higher on Thursday taking support from continued U.S interest and strong local LPG prices.
"Naphtha has been lagging LPG rises, so there's some room to catch-up," said one trader.
Traders said cif full range cargoes were pegged around $233-236 amid good supplies, about $2-3 higher.
European interest was still minimal with end-users looking relaxed and for the most part covered.
A light virgin parcel was done at around high cif +$4 into ARA.
Swap cargoes were up $4 or so at $234-236 for Jan with Febuary and March also gaining ground.
Estimates put around 50,000 tonnes available before January 25 in addition to a few Russian pieces.
